pin.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a short thin piece of metal with a sharp point at one end, used especially for fastening together pieces of cloth while making clothes
pin.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a thin piece of metal used to fasten things together, especially broken bones
pin.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a piece of metal, sometimes containing jewels, that you fasten to your clothes to wear as a decoration
pin.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: one of the pieces of metal that sticks out of an electric plug
pin.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: one of the bottle-shaped objects that you try to knock down in a game of bowling
pin.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: a short piece of metal which you pull out of a hand grenade to make it explode a short time later
pin.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: a metal stick with a flag at the top which marks the holes on a golf course
pin.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to fasten something somewhere, or to join two things together, using a pin
pin.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: Can you pin this to the notice board?
He pinned the name tag on his jacket.
She had photos of her kids pinned up next to her desk.
pin.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to make someone unable to move by putting a lot of pressure or weight on them
pin.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: He pinned her arms to her sides.
Albert got him pinned against the wall.
They managed to pin him down until the police arrived.
Her body was pinned under the weight of the car.
pin.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a number that you use when you get money from a machine using a plastic card
pin.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: personal identification number; a secret number given to you by your bank that you use when getting money from a cash machine with a card
pin.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: We will notify you of your PIN shortly after the account is opened.
Never tell anyone your PIN number.
